Posts.Content: Jun 21, 2011 06:31PM - edited Jun 21, 2011 06:32PM by bonnieandcleo hi coolbreeze I am on navelbine and avastin....its fone so far ..have it every two weeks but I do have a port and its fantastic...so easy no looking for veins ..well worth it...no SEs really ...a little tired but I do work full time and my bloods are doing o k have had 5 sessions so far and all good...in fact I have a large mass at the superclavicle and its getting smaller I can see it shrinking...the tulour markers are going down slowly the nurse told me on friday...the best of luck I do have a bit of pins and needles in one finger and thumb but it had started before treatment ...i take neurontin and so its manageable....I plan to live for years and years...best of luck to everyone Â  (((((((((hugs))))))))) coolbreeze

Posts.Content: Apr 29, 2011 12:44PM - edited Apr 29, 2011 12:45PM by bonnieandcleo I am a 27 yr survivor ...1984 I had ful masec and then was on tamox for 15 yrs and had to come off it I guess I am stage 4 since 2005 with reacur in chest wall was on arimidex ...got lymphdema in 2010 and reacur and then aromasin....I was sterilised by rads in 1984 I was 34. Now reacur and on Navelbine and avastin started last fri planning another 20 yrs please god. This is 1st line chemo and will have it for 3 months at least every 2 weeks bit of a shock but still planning what I will do when I grow up. I am teaching and back to work on tues after Easter hols. I do have up and down days but hopefully getting head round this and who knows. my daughter gets married in septem ber 1st goal ...maybe hol in Australia next year. Love reading about everyone. life is but a blink of an eye and we should try to live every minuite. Take care hugs to everyone.
